_header: Lo this noble and victorious conqueror
Note: Formerly listed under 5731; for other verses on the kings, see 5731, 727, 1472
Subjects: kings of England; William the Conqueror; Edward I; Edward II; Henry II; Henry III; John, king
_description: On the Kings of England from William the Conqueror to Edward II — ten rhyme royal stanzas

BodDig196.First Lines:
loo [t]his noble and victorous conqueror[W]illiam duke of alle
                    Normundy[ ]d it conquered þis land to hys honourAll dret
                    puissaunce of cheualry…
BodDig196.Last Lines:
…& ȝet by hys quene was slawe by treson[ ] a traytour
                    entrewe hys name hygth mortymerThis nobil kyng he regned ful xx ȝere
                    [buried at] Glo[ ]
